definition: elderly, as in movement or bearing

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: The faces of the children looked old already, because they were so hungry.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的脸已显出老态，因为他们太饥饿了。

sentences.english: Should I look older just to be put on your shelf?
sentences.chinese: 我是否应该让自己看上去老态龙钟好让你放下呢？

sentences.english: Not knowing their own flaws is already doddering attitude.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知自身漏洞百出早已呈老态龙钟之态。

sentences.english: In the Guangzhou Zoo I saw a South China tiger in its doddering old age.
sentences.chinese: 在广州动物园我看见一只老态龙钟的华南虎。

definition: wan and sallow/thin and pallid/haggard/(of plants) withered
to put on weight/to get fat (a sign of prosperity, so a compliment)
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
to age/to deteriorate with age/old and weak
